info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 12 at 2:56AM MDT until June 12 at 3:30AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM MDT FOR EAST CENTRAL UNION COUNTY... At 254 AM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Clayton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Clayton. This includes Highway 64 between Mile Markers 421 and 429. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Heavy rains may flood intersections, ditches and underpasses. Do not attempt to drive through areas where water covers the roadway. Since the ground is still saturated from heavy rain that fell in Clayton on Saturday, flash flooding may quickly develop as this storm crosses between 3 to 330 AM MDT this morning.
